name: Default values on page load
steps: Step 1: Open the application
expected: Input text area is empty, checkboxes are unchecked, values of Total characters, Word count and Sentence count are 00. Letter density is empty.

name: Typing text inside the input text area
steps: Step 1: Set mouse over the input text area
Step 2: Click inside the input text area
Step 3: Type text "Hello World! This is a test."
expected: After step 1: cursor becomes a click pointer. After step 2: border color of the input text area changes to purple. Before step 3: Placeholder is still visible. After step 3: Placeholder disappears, typed text appears inside the input text area.

name: Total characters are updating on typing text
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc def"
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 07. Counter updates in real-time as user types. Spaces are also counted.

name: Total characters are updating on deleting text
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc def"
Step 3: Delete the text by deleting letters one by one
Step 4: Repeat step 2
Step 5: Mark all text and delete
expected: Counter updates in real-time as user deletes text. After step 3 and 5: Total characters counter shows 00.

name: All kinds of characters are counted
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc DEF 123 !@#"
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 15. All kinds of characters including uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special characters and spaces are counted.

name: Pasting text updates the counter
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Copy text "Pasting text updates the counter" to clipboard
Step 3: Paste the text inside the input text area
expected: After step 3: Total characters counter shows 32. Counter updates in real-time as user pastes text.

name: Leading and trailing spaces are counted
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text " abc "
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 05. Leading and trailing spaces are counted.

name: Multiple consecutive spaces are counted
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "a  b  &nbsp  c"
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 07. Multiple consecutive spaces are counted.

name: Total characters counter shows leading 0 only if value is less than 10
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abcdefghi"
Step 3: Add one more character to make it 10 characters
Step 4: Delete last character to make it 9 characters again
expected: After step 2: Total characters counter shows 09 with leading 0. After step 3: Total characters counter shows 10 without leading 0. After decreasing back to 9 characters in step 4: Total characters counter shows 09 with leading 0 again.

name: New line is counted as a character
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc{enter}def"
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 07. New line is counted as a character.

name: Total characters header has "(no space)" addition
steps: Step 1: Check the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
Step 2: Uncheck the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
expected: After step 1: Total characters header changes from 'Total characters' to 'Total characters (no space)'. After step 2: Total characters header changes back to 'Total characters'.

name: Leading, inner and trailing spaces are not counted
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Check the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
Step 3: Type text " abc def "
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 06. Leading, inner and trailing spaces are not counted.

name: Total characters are updating after checking and unchecking the checkbox
steps: Step 1: Check the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
Step 2: Click inside the input text area
Step 3: Type text "abc def"
Step 4: Uncheck the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
Step 5: Check the checkbox again
expected: After step 3: Total characters counter shows 06. Changing the checkbox updates the counter immediately. After step 4: Total characters counter shows 07. After step 5: Total characters counter shows 06 again.

name: All kinds of characters are counted except spaces
steps: Step 1: Check the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
Step 2: Click inside the input text area
Step 3: Type text "abc DEF 123 !@#"
expected: After typing text, Total characters counter shows 13. All kinds of characters except spaces are counted.

name: Word count is updating on typing and deleting text
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input area
Step 2: Type text: "Hello World"
Step 3: Clear whole text
expected: After step 2: Word count shows 02. After step 3: Word count shows 00.

name: Letters, numbers, asterisks, underscores and polish characters are part of words
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc ABC 123 ąęść ĄĘŚĆ te_xt te*xt 1a two-words word1.word2"
expected: After typing text, Word count shows 12. All of these parts (separated by spaces) are counted as words except "two-words" which is counted as two separate words.

name: Word count counter shows leading 0 only if value is less than 10
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text with 9 words
Step 3: Add one more word to make it 10 words
Step 4: Delete last word to make it 9 words again
expected: After step 2: Word count shows 09 with leading 0. After step 3: Word count shows 10 without leading 0. After decreasing back to 9 words in step 4: Word count shows 09 with leading 0 again.

name: Pasting text updates the word count
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Copy text "Pasting text updates the word count" to clipboard
Step 3: Paste the text inside the input text area
expected: After step 3: Word count shows 06. Counter updates in real-time as user pastes text.

name: Separators are not counted as words
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "&nbsp ,.!?;:-()[]{}<>/\|"
expected: After typing text, Word count shows 00. Separators are not counted as words.

name: Multiple consecutive spaces do not create empty words
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "a  b &nbsp&nbspc"
expected: After typing text, Word count shows 03. Multiple consecutive spaces do not create empty words.

name: Leading and trailing spaces do not create empty words
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text " abc def "
expected: After typing text, Word count shows 02. Leading and trailing spaces do not create empty words.

name: Underscores are part of words
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "_abc_ _def_ _"
expected: After typing text, Word count shows 03: '_abc_', '_def_' and '_' are counted as words.

name: New line is a separator for words
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc {enter} def"
expected: After typing text, Word count shows 02. New line is a separator for words.

name: Checkbox 'exclude spaces' does not affect word count
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abc def"
Step 3: Check the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
Step 4: Uncheck the checkbox 'Exclude spaces'
expected: After step 2: Word count shows 02. After step 3 and 4: Word count remains 02. Checkbox 'exclude spaces' does not affect word count.

name: Sentence count is updating on typing and deleting text
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input area
Step 2: Type text: "Hello World. This is a test."
Step 3: Clear whole text
expected: After step 2: Sentence count shows 02. After step 3: Sentence count shows 00.

name: Sentences are separated by characters: . ! ? ...
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "This is sentence one. This is sentence two! Is this sentence three? This is not the end... Or is it"
expected: After typing text, Sentence count shows 05. Sentences (without separator): 'This is sentence one',   'This is sentence two',   'Is this sentence three',   'This is not the end'    'Or is it'.

name: Sentence count counter shows leading 0 only if value is less than 10
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text with 9 sentences (e.g. "1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. 9.")
Step 3: Add one more sentence to make it 10 sentences
Step 4: Delete last sentence to make it 9 sentences again
expected: After step 2: Sentence count shows 09 with leading 0. After step 3: Sentence count shows 10 without leading 0. After decreasing back to 9 sentences in step 4: Sentence count shows 09 with leading 0 again.

name: Sentence is counted only if it has at least one word
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "Sentence 1. ! Sentence 2?Sentence 3... Sentence 4# and still sentence 4".. . ?()sentence 5".
expected: After typing text, Sentence count shows 05. Sentences without words (like '!', '...') are not counted.

name: Last sentence does not need to end with a separator to be counted
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "This is sentence one. This is sentence two! This is sentence three"
Step 3: Clear whole text
Step 4: Type text "This is sentence one"
expected: After step 2: Sentence count shows 03. After step 4: Sentence count shows 01.

name: Sentence can have multiple lines
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "This is sentence one{enter}still sentence one.{enter}This is sentence two."
expected: After typing text, Sentence count shows 02.

name: Sentence does not need to have letters to be counted
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "12345! _. Ąć1#? (){}[]"
expected:
After typing text, Sentence count shows 02.
Sentences: '12345',   '_'    'Ąć1#'.

name: Letter density appears after typing letters
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "12345! _"
Step 3: Add letter "a" to the text
expected:
After step 2 Letter density is still empty. After step 3, Letter density shows:
A: 1 (100.00%)

name: After letter density appears, message 'No characters found. Start typing to see letter density.' disappears
steps: Step 1: Make text area empty
Step 2: Type text "a"
Step 3: Clear text area
expected:
After step 1: Letter density shows message 'No characters found. Start typing to see letter density.'. After step 2: Letter density shows:
A: 1 (100.00%) and message disappears. After step 3: Letter density shows message 'No characters found. Start typing to see letter density.' again.

name: Density shows letter (left side of progress bar), number of occurrences and percentage (right side of progress bar)
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "aabb"
expected:
After typing text, Letter density shows:
A: 2 (50,00%)
B: 2 (50.00%)
On the left side of a progress bar is the letter, on the right side is number of occurrences and percentage of density in whole text.

name: Letter density includes only letters
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "abaA 1_23 !@#."
expected:
Letter density counts only letters (case insensitive). After typing text, Letter density shows:
A: 3 (75,00%)
B: 1 (25.00%)

name: Letter density is case insensitive
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "aA Bb"
expected:
After typing text, Letter density shows:
A: 2 (50.00%)
B: 2 (50.00%)

name: Letter density is sorted by number of occurrences (descending). If two letters have the same number of occurrences, first is the one that appeared first in the text
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "CCbAa"
Step 3: Add letter: "A" to the text
Step 4: Add letter: "C" to the text
Step 5: Add letters: "CA" to the text
expected:
After step 2, Letter density shows:
C: 2 (40.00%)
A: 2 (40.00%)
B: 1 (20.00%)
After step 3, letter density shows:
A: 3 (50,00%)
C: 2 (33.33%)
B: 1 (16.67%)
After step 4, letter density shows:
C: 3 (42.86%)
A: 3 (42.86%)
B: 1 (14.29%).
Step 5 does not change the order:
C: 4 (44.44%)
A: 4 (44.44%)
B: 1 (11.11%)

name: Percentage is calculated as number of occurrences divided by total number of letters with two decimal places. Only letters are counted, other characters are ignored
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "aA1 Bb_#{enter}CC?!"
expected:
Total number of letters is 6 (a, A, B, b, C, C). After typing text, Letter density shows:
A: 2 (33.33%)
B: 2 (33.33%)
C: 2 (33.33%)

name: Density for a letter is removed when there are no occurrences of that letter in the text
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "aabbcc"
Step 3: Delete all letters "a" from the text
expected:
After step 2, Letter density shows:
A: 2 (33.33%)
B: 2 (33.33%)
C: 2 (33.33%)
After step 3, Letter density shows:
B: 2 (50.00%)
C: 2 (50.00%)

name: Progress bar has width proportional to percentage value
steps: Step 1: Click inside the input text area
Step 2: Type text "ab"
Step 3: Remove letter "b" from the text
Step 4: Add letters "cccc" to the text
Step 5: Add some more letters "c" to the text (about 5-10 more)
expected: After step 2 progress bars for A and B have the same width (50%). After step 3 progress bar for A has 100% width. After step 4 progress bar for C is longer than progress bar for A. In step 5 progress bar width for C increases with more letters C added. Progress bar is filled with the same color as total characters block background.
